claim: Preprints represented less than 1% of the total number of journal articles in the life sciences published in 2016 (Fig 1).
title: Fig 1. Percentage of preprints in Europe PMC posted yearly between 2013–2023.
caption: For each year the number of preprints in Europe PMC is divided by the total number of research articles, including preprints and PubMed journal articles published in the same period. Accessed 8 April 2024.

claim: In 2023 the share of life science preprints had grown to 10.7% (Fig 1).
title: Fig 1. Percentage of preprints in Europe PMC posted yearly between 2013–2023.
caption: For each year the number of preprints in Europe PMC is divided by the total number of research articles, including preprints and PubMed journal articles published in the same period. Accessed 8 April 2024.

claim: Within the first two months of the pandemic they comprised over 30% of the published COVID-19 research (Fig 2A).
title: Fig 2. Preprints comprise a significant portion of COVID-19 research.
caption: (A) Percentage of COVID-19 preprints (in blue) and COVID-19 journal articles (in green) available in Europe PMC by month. This data includes preprints that have been subsequently published as a journal article. (B) Percentage of COVID-19 journal articles preceded by a preprint (in teal). Accessed 8 April 2024.

claim: Roughly 2–7% of COVID-19 journal articles published in 2020–2023 were preceded by a preprint (Fig 2B).
title: Fig 2. Preprints comprise a significant portion of COVID-19 research.
caption: (A) Percentage of COVID-19 preprints (in blue) and COVID-19 journal articles (in green) available in Europe PMC by month. This data includes preprints that have been subsequently published as a journal article. (B) Percentage of COVID-19 journal articles preceded by a preprint (in teal). Accessed 8 April 2024.

claim: For example, it is possible to filter the search to return preprints only (Fig 3A).
title: Fig 3. Europe PMC search filters for preprints, journal-published preprints, and reviewed preprints.
caption: Screenshot of the Europe PMC search results shown for a (Single-cell RNA expression profiling of ACE2) query with the Preprints filter on (A). When the ‘Preprints’ filter is selected, additional sub-filters are displayed: ‘Journal published’ filter (B) for preprints with an associated journal published version and ‘Reviewed’ filter (C) for preprints with associated reviews and evaluations.

claim: Additional filters help find preprints that have been published as a journal article (Fig 3B), or have an associated review or evaluation (Fig 3C).
title: Fig 3. Europe PMC search filters for preprints, journal-published preprints, and reviewed preprints.
caption: Screenshot of the Europe PMC search results shown for a (Single-cell RNA expression profiling of ACE2) query with the Preprints filter on (A). When the ‘Preprints’ filter is selected, additional sub-filters are displayed: ‘Journal published’ filter (B) for preprints with an associated journal published version and ‘Reviewed’ filter (C) for preprints with associated reviews and evaluations.

claim: Preprints are labelled with a green ‘Preprint’ tag, both in search results (Fig 4A), and on the preprint page (Fig 4B).
title: Fig 4. Display of preprints in search results (top) and on the preprint record page (bottom) in Europe PMC.
caption: The top figure displays a screenshot of the Europe PMC search results page for a (cognitive decline in TDP-43 proteinopathy) query. The bottom figure displays a screenshot of the Europe PMC preprint page for the PPR596760 record. (A) Preprints in search results are labelled with a green ‘Preprint’ tag that also displays version number. (B) The green ‘Preprint’ tag and (C) a yellow banner indicate that the record being viewed is a preprint. (D) Hovering over the question mark in the banner evokes a pop-up with additional information about preprints. (E) Preprint version history with hyperlinks and publication dates for previous versions.

claim: The preprint page also displays a yellow banner indicating to the user that the record they are viewing is a preprint (Fig 4C).
title: Fig 4. Display of preprints in search results (top) and on the preprint record page (bottom) in Europe PMC.
caption: The top figure displays a screenshot of the Europe PMC search results page for a (cognitive decline in TDP-43 proteinopathy) query. The bottom figure displays a screenshot of the Europe PMC preprint page for the PPR596760 record. (A) Preprints in search results are labelled with a green ‘Preprint’ tag that also displays version number. (B) The green ‘Preprint’ tag and (C) a yellow banner indicate that the record being viewed is a preprint. (D) Hovering over the question mark in the banner evokes a pop-up with additional information about preprints. (E) Preprint version history with hyperlinks and publication dates for previous versions.

claim: Hovering over the question mark sign in the banner brings up additional clarification about preprints (Fig 4D).
title: Fig 4. Display of preprints in search results (top) and on the preprint record page (bottom) in Europe PMC.
caption: The top figure displays a screenshot of the Europe PMC search results page for a (cognitive decline in TDP-43 proteinopathy) query. The bottom figure displays a screenshot of the Europe PMC preprint page for the PPR596760 record. (A) Preprints in search results are labelled with a green ‘Preprint’ tag that also displays version number. (B) The green ‘Preprint’ tag and (C) a yellow banner indicate that the record being viewed is a preprint. (D) Hovering over the question mark in the banner evokes a pop-up with additional information about preprints. (E) Preprint version history with hyperlinks and publication dates for previous versions.

claim: All preprint versions can be accessed from the ‘Preprint version history’ drop down (Fig 4E).
title: Fig 4. Display of preprints in search results (top) and on the preprint record page (bottom) in Europe PMC.
caption: The top figure displays a screenshot of the Europe PMC search results page for a (cognitive decline in TDP-43 proteinopathy) query. The bottom figure displays a screenshot of the Europe PMC preprint page for the PPR596760 record. (A) Preprints in search results are labelled with a green ‘Preprint’ tag that also displays version number. (B) The green ‘Preprint’ tag and (C) a yellow banner indicate that the record being viewed is a preprint. (D) Hovering over the question mark in the banner evokes a pop-up with additional information about preprints. (E) Preprint version history with hyperlinks and publication dates for previous versions.

claim: Version distribution for preprints in Europe PMC is shown in Fig 5.
title: Fig 5. Number of preprint records that have more than one version in Europe PMC.
caption: This graph displays the number of preprints for which the latest version available is version 2 or higher. The data presented in this graph excludes preprints from servers that issue a single identifier for all versions. Accessed 8 April 2024.

claim: The link to the journal article is displayed in the yellow warning banner for all preprint versions (Fig 6A).
title: Fig 6. Preprint–journal article links in Europe PMC.
caption: Screenshots of the information banner on the preprint page with a link to the published journal article (A) and corresponding banner on the journal article page with a link to the latest preprint version (B). A graph showing the percentage of preprints with an associated journal published version in Europe PMC between 2013–2023 (C). The data presented here includes Open Research Platforms, such as F1000 Research, Access Microbiology, etc. Accessed 8 April 2024.

claim: In turn, the blue information banner on the journal article page provides a link to the latest preprint version (Fig 6B).
title: Fig 6. Preprint–journal article links in Europe PMC.
caption: Screenshots of the information banner on the preprint page with a link to the published journal article (A) and corresponding banner on the journal article page with a link to the latest preprint version (B). A graph showing the percentage of preprints with an associated journal published version in Europe PMC between 2013–2023 (C). The data presented here includes Open Research Platforms, such as F1000 Research, Access Microbiology, etc. Accessed 8 April 2024.

claim: For example, 22% preprints posted in 2023 have been published, in comparison to 62% of preprints posted in 2013 (Fig 6C).
title: Fig 6. Preprint–journal article links in Europe PMC.
caption: Screenshots of the information banner on the preprint page with a link to the published journal article (A) and corresponding banner on the journal article page with a link to the latest preprint version (B). A graph showing the percentage of preprints with an associated journal published version in Europe PMC between 2013–2023 (C). The data presented here includes Open Research Platforms, such as F1000 Research, Access Microbiology, etc. Accessed 8 April 2024.

claim: In Europe PMC, removed and withdrawn preprints are clearly labelled with a red warning banner (Fig 7A and 7B).
title: Fig 7. Display or removed and withdrawn preprints in Europe PMC.
caption: Warning banners for removed preprint (A), withdrawn preprint (B), and preprint version preceding a withdrawn preprint (C).

claim: The same banner is also present on earlier versions if those exist in Europe PMC (Fig 7C).
title: Fig 7. Display or removed and withdrawn preprints in Europe PMC.
caption: Warning banners for removed preprint (A), withdrawn preprint (B), and preprint version preceding a withdrawn preprint (C).

claim: This includes the preprint abstract and full text where available (Fig 8A).
title: Fig 8. Preprint record display in Europe PMC.
caption: Screenshot of the preprint page for the PPR130125 record. (A) Preprint abstract, as well as figures and full text, where available, are accessible from the navigation panel on the left. The same panel provides access to additional sections with links to related content (B), such as ‘Citations & impact’, ‘Data’, ‘Reviews and evaluations’, and ‘Funding’. The navigation panel on the right provides options to ‘Get citation’, ‘Open PDF’, or ‘Claim to ORCID’ (C).

claim: Those tools are available within the navigation panel on the right (Fig 8B).
title: Fig 8. Preprint record display in Europe PMC.
caption: Screenshot of the preprint page for the PPR130125 record. (A) Preprint abstract, as well as figures and full text, where available, are accessible from the navigation panel on the left. The same panel provides access to additional sections with links to related content (B), such as ‘Citations & impact’, ‘Data’, ‘Reviews and evaluations’, and ‘Funding’. The navigation panel on the right provides options to ‘Get citation’, ‘Open PDF’, or ‘Claim to ORCID’ (C).

claim: The navigation panel on the left (Fig 8C) provides access to related content.
title: Fig 8. Preprint record display in Europe PMC.
caption: Screenshot of the preprint page for the PPR130125 record. (A) Preprint abstract, as well as figures and full text, where available, are accessible from the navigation panel on the left. The same panel provides access to additional sections with links to related content (B), such as ‘Citations & impact’, ‘Data’, ‘Reviews and evaluations’, and ‘Funding’. The navigation panel on the right provides options to ‘Get citation’, ‘Open PDF’, or ‘Claim to ORCID’ (C).

claim: Preprint review status is disclosed in the yellow warning banner (Fig 9A and 9B).
title: Fig 9. Linking reviews to preprints in Europe PMC.
caption: Information banner for a reviewed preprint (A) and a preprint posted on an Open Research platform (B). (C) Information banner and version history indicate that reviews and evaluations are available for a later version of a preprint. (D) Screenshot of the ‘Reviews and evaluations’ section for the PPR279548 record.

claim: For earlier preprint versions it is also shown in the version history (Fig 9C).
title: Fig 9. Linking reviews to preprints in Europe PMC.
caption: Information banner for a reviewed preprint (A) and a preprint posted on an Open Research platform (B). (C) Information banner and version history indicate that reviews and evaluations are available for a later version of a preprint. (D) Screenshot of the ‘Reviews and evaluations’ section for the PPR279548 record.

claim: Where available, Europe PMC shows evaluation date, review title or type, and evaluator name (Fig 9D).
title: Fig 9. Linking reviews to preprints in Europe PMC.
caption: Information banner for a reviewed preprint (A) and a preprint posted on an Open Research platform (B). (C) Information banner and version history indicate that reviews and evaluations are available for a later version of a preprint. (D) Screenshot of the ‘Reviews and evaluations’ section for the PPR279548 record.

claim: For example, Europe PMC displays modified banners for preprints from Open Research Platforms (Fig 9B).
title: Fig 9. Linking reviews to preprints in Europe PMC.
caption: Information banner for a reviewed preprint (A) and a preprint posted on an Open Research platform (B). (C) Information banner and version history indicate that reviews and evaluations are available for a later version of a preprint. (D) Screenshot of the ‘Reviews and evaluations’ section for the PPR279548 record.

claim: Figure 2 and lines 90-91: The numbers were higher than 30 only for the first two months, so it would be more precise to replace “few” with “two”.
title: Fig 2. Preprints comprise a significant portion of COVID-19 research.
caption: (A) Percentage of COVID-19 preprints (in blue) and COVID-19 journal articles (in green) available in Europe PMC by month. This data includes preprints that have been subsequently published as a journal article. (B) Percentage of COVID-19 journal articles preceded by a preprint (in teal). Accessed 8 April 2024.
